docs.text: Alliance-Schema-Prototype-Core-Types schema Alliance Schema Prototype with LinkML Classes Agent - person, group, organization or project that provides a piece of information (i.e. a knowledge association) Assembly Entity - Root Biolink Model class for all things and informational relationships, real or imagined. Association - A typed association between two entities, supported by evidence NamedThing - a databased entity or concept/class BiologicalEntity MolecularEntity - A gene, gene product, small molecule or macromolecule (including protein complex)" GenomicEntity - an entity that can either be directly located on a genome (gene, transcript, exon, regulatory region) or is encoded in a genome (protein) Allele Chromosome Gene - A region (or regions) that includes all of the sequence elements necessary to encode a functional transcript. A gene locus may include regulatory regions, transcribed regions and/or other functional sequence regions. Transcript - An RNA synthesized on a DNA or RNA template by an RNA polymerase. Ontology - a concept or class in an ontology, vocabulary or thesaurus GoTerm SoTerm Feature GenomicLocation Identifier InformationContentEntity - a piece of information that typically describes some topic of discourse or is used as support. Note Species Synonym Mixins Slots association slot - any slot that relates an association to another entity negated - if set to true, then the association is negated i.e. is not true object - connects an association to the object of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object. predicate - A high-level grouping for the relationship type. AKA minimal predicate. This is analogous to category for nodes. qualifiers - This is the MeSH qualifier term that is optionally added to the descriptor term. relation - The relation which describes an association between a subject and an object in a more granular manner. Usually this is a term from Relation Ontology, but it can be any edge CURIE. subject - connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object. category association➞category data provider - MOD that provided data date_produced - date AGR data generated by MOD description - a human-readable description of an entity id - A unique identifier for a thing. Must be either a CURIE shorthand for a URI or a complete URI agent➞id - Different classes of agents have distinct preferred identifiers. For publishers, use the ISBN publisher code. See https://grp.isbn-international.org/ for publisher code lookups. For editors, authors and individual providers, use the individual's ORCID if available; Otherwise, a ScopusID, ResearchID or Google Scholar ID ('GSID') may be used if the author ORCID is unknown. Institutional agents could be identified by an International Standard Name Identifier ('ISNI') code. name - a human-readable name for an entity agent➞name - it is recommended that an author's 'name' property be formatted as "surname, firstname initial." node property - A grouping for any property that holds between a node and a value address - the particulars of the place where someone or an organization is situated. For now, this slot is a simple text "blob" containing all relevant details of the given location for fitness of purpose. For the moment, this "address" can include other contact details such as email and phone number(?). creation date - date on which an entity was created. This can be applied to nodes or edges information content entity➞creation date - Precedence of identifiers for references is as follows: PMID if available; DOI if not; actual alternate CURIE otherwise. has authors has biological sequence - connects a genomic feature to its sequence has cross references symbol - Symbol for a particular thing related to - A relationship that is asserted between two named things from_species - holds between a genomic entity and a species has assembly - holds between a genomic entity and an assembly has feature - holds between a named thing and a feature has gene - holds between a named thing and a gene has genomic location - holds between a genomic entity and a genomic location has go term - holds between a named thing and a gene ontology term has identifier - holds between a named thing and an identifier has note - holds between a named thing and a note has ontology - holds between a named thing and an ontology has publisher has references - holds between a named thing and a reference has so term - holds between a named thing and a sequence ontology term has synonym - holds between a named thing and a synonym has synonyms has transcript - holds between a named thing and a transcript on chromosome - holds between a genomic entity and a chromosome release - MOD release ID title - A human readable title for a reference. type - rdf:type of biolink:Association should be fixed at rdf:Statement association➞type volumes Types Built in Bool Decimal ElementIdentifier NCName NodeIdentifier URI URIorCURIE XSDDate XSDDateTime XSDTime float int str Defined BiologicalSequence ( String ) Boolean ( Bool ) - A binary (true or false) value Date ( XSDDate ) - a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar Datetime ( XSDDateTime ) - The combination of a date and time Decimal ( Decimal ) - A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification Double ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer ( int ) - An integer Ncname ( NCName ) - Prefix part of CURIE Nodeidentifier ( NodeIdentifier ) - A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model. Objectidentifier ( ElementIdentifier ) - A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model. String ( str ) - A character string Time ( XSDTime ) - A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day Uri ( URI ) - a complete URI Uriorcurie ( URIorCURIE ) - a URI or a CURIE
docs.title: Index

docs.text: Agent - person, group, organization or project that provides a piece of information (i.e. a knowledge association) Assembly Entity - Root Biolink Model class for all things and informational relationships, real or imagined. Association - A typed association between two entities, supported by evidence NamedThing - a databased entity or concept/class BiologicalEntity MolecularEntity - A gene, gene product, small molecule or macromolecule (including protein complex)" GenomicEntity - an entity that can either be directly located on a genome (gene, transcript, exon, regulatory region) or is encoded in a genome (protein) Allele Chromosome Gene - A region (or regions) that includes all of the sequence elements necessary to encode a functional transcript. A gene locus may include regulatory regions, transcribed regions and/or other functional sequence regions. Transcript - An RNA synthesized on a DNA or RNA template by an RNA polymerase. Ontology - a concept or class in an ontology, vocabulary or thesaurus GoTerm SoTerm Feature GenomicLocation Identifier InformationContentEntity - a piece of information that typically describes some topic of discourse or is used as support. Note Species Synonym

docs.text: association slot - any slot that relates an association to another entity negated - if set to true, then the association is negated i.e. is not true object - connects an association to the object of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object. predicate - A high-level grouping for the relationship type. AKA minimal predicate. This is analogous to category for nodes. qualifiers - This is the MeSH qualifier term that is optionally added to the descriptor term. relation - The relation which describes an association between a subject and an object in a more granular manner. Usually this is a term from Relation Ontology, but it can be any edge CURIE. subject - connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object. category association➞category data provider - MOD that provided data date_produced - date AGR data generated by MOD description - a human-readable description of an entity id - A unique identifier for a thing. Must be either a CURIE shorthand for a URI or a complete URI agent➞id - Different classes of agents have distinct preferred identifiers. For publishers, use the ISBN publisher code. See https://grp.isbn-international.org/ for publisher code lookups. For editors, authors and individual providers, use the individual's ORCID if available; Otherwise, a ScopusID, ResearchID or Google Scholar ID ('GSID') may be used if the author ORCID is unknown. Institutional agents could be identified by an International Standard Name Identifier ('ISNI') code. name - a human-readable name for an entity agent➞name - it is recommended that an author's 'name' property be formatted as "surname, firstname initial." node property - A grouping for any property that holds between a node and a value address - the particulars of the place where someone or an organization is situated. For now, this slot is a simple text "blob" containing all relevant details of the given location for fitness of purpose. For the moment, this "address" can include other contact details such as email and phone number(?). creation date - date on which an entity was created. This can be applied to nodes or edges information content entity➞creation date - Precedence of identifiers for references is as follows: PMID if available; DOI if not; actual alternate CURIE otherwise. has authors has biological sequence - connects a genomic feature to its sequence has cross references symbol - Symbol for a particular thing related to - A relationship that is asserted between two named things from_species - holds between a genomic entity and a species has assembly - holds between a genomic entity and an assembly has feature - holds between a named thing and a feature has gene - holds between a named thing and a gene has genomic location - holds between a genomic entity and a genomic location has go term - holds between a named thing and a gene ontology term has identifier - holds between a named thing and an identifier has note - holds between a named thing and a note has ontology - holds between a named thing and an ontology has publisher has references - holds between a named thing and a reference has so term - holds between a named thing and a sequence ontology term has synonym - holds between a named thing and a synonym has synonyms has transcript - holds between a named thing and a transcript on chromosome - holds between a genomic entity and a chromosome release - MOD release ID title - A human readable title for a reference. type - rdf:type of biolink:Association should be fixed at rdf:Statement association➞type volumes

Objectidentifier ( ElementIdentifier ) - A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model. docs.text: Type: agent person, group, organization or project that provides a piece of information (i.e. a knowledge association) URI: alliance:Agent Referenced by class Attributes Own agent➞id REQ Description: Different classes of agents have distinct preferred identifiers. For publishers, use the ISBN publisher code. See https://grp.isbn-international.org/ for publisher code lookups. For editors, authors and individual providers, use the individual's ORCID if available; Otherwise, a ScopusID, ResearchID or Google Scholar ID ('GSID') may be used if the author ORCID is unknown. Institutional agents could be identified by an International Standard Name Identifier ('ISNI') code. range: Uriorcurie agent➞name OPT Description: it is recommended that an author's 'name' property be formatted as "surname, firstname initial." range: String Other properties Aliases: group

docs.text: Type: address the particulars of the place where someone or an organization is situated. For now, this slot is a simple text "blob" containing all relevant details of the given location for fitness of purpose. For the moment, this "address" can include other contact details such as email and phone number(?). URI: alliance:address Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: node property Children Used by
docs.title: Type: address

docs.text: Type: agent_id Different classes of agents have distinct preferred identifiers. For publishers, use the ISBN publisher code. See https://grp.isbn-international.org/ for publisher code lookups. For editors, authors and individual providers, use the individual's ORCID if available; Otherwise, a ScopusID, ResearchID or Google Scholar ID ('GSID') may be used if the author ORCID is unknown. Institutional agents could be identified by an International Standard Name Identifier ('ISNI') code. URI: alliance:agent_id Domain and Range Agent -> REQ Uriorcurie Parents is_a: id Children Used by Agent
docs.title: Type: agent_id

docs.text: Different classes of agents have distinct preferred identifiers. For publishers, use the ISBN publisher code. See https://grp.isbn-international.org/ for publisher code lookups. For editors, authors and individual providers, use the individual's ORCID if available; Otherwise, a ScopusID, ResearchID or Google Scholar ID ('GSID') may be used if the author ORCID is unknown. Institutional agents could be identified by an International Standard Name Identifier ('ISNI') code. URI: alliance:agent_id

docs.text: Type: relation The relation which describes an association between a subject and an object in a more granular manner. Usually this is a term from Relation Ontology, but it can be any edge CURIE. URI: alliance:relation Domain and Range Association -> REQ Uriorcurie Parents is_a: association slot Children Used by Association

docs.text: Type: subject connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object. URI: alliance:subject Domain and Range Association -> REQ NamedThing Parents is_a: association slot Children Used by Association Other properties Exact Mappings: owl:annotatedSource OBAN:association_has_subject biolink:subject
docs.title: Type: subject
